title: NY PACER Access & Contract for ICE

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On 7/23/2025 there was a Final Purchase made by ICE to the PACER SERVICE CENTER for $11,000. The description of requirement is "This award provides officers in the Enforcement and Removal Operations New York City Area access to Public Access to Court Electronic Records to assist in rendering case decisions. This modification exercises and funds option period 4."

I am requesting the following documents relating to this specific transaction:
1) All conformed contracts, agreements, and legal/procurement agreements between Immigrations and Customs Enforcement and Pacer. 
2) All PACER invoices and lists of related queries (if provided as part of the PACER invoice) 
3) All documents pertaining to live monitoring, alerts, alert configurations, API configurations, and other alert systems ICE uses through PACER (if any exist) 

Thank you in advance for your time.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alan J. Segal

title: Public Records Request Log - West Virginia Department of Environmental Protection

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Public Records Request Log - West Virginia Department of Environmental Protection
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

> A dataset (CSV or Excel preferred) containing all effluent exceedances and Clean Water Act violations reported through the eDMR system for NPDES-permitted facilities in the state of West Virginia from 2020 through 2025. 

Please include, if available:
- Facility name
- NPDES permit number
- Monitoring period (start and end dates)
- Pollutant or parameter exceeded
- Reported value and permitted limit
- Violation classification
- Enforcement action taken (if applicable)
- County or facility location

I am requesting these records for research and educational purposes and respectfully request a waiver of any applicable fees. If fees are expected to exceed $50, please notify me in advance.

I am requesting this information in digital format and prefer delivery via email or secure file download link.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Amelia Minder

title: Flock Safety Audit

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the Manchester Police Department’s Flock Safety system, specifically:

CONTRACTS and AGREEMENTS
• All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Flock Safety that were active any time between 1/1/2025 and to the date this request is processed.  This includes documentation related to the acquisition, leasing, or use of Flock Safety cameras or services, including data platforms or analytics tools.

GUIDING DOCUMENTATION and POLICIES
• All policies, memorandums of understanding, and other guidance materials generated by this agency and/or entity operating on its behalf regarding the acquisition and use of any data or services provided by Flock Safety and any representative thereof or any subdivision thereof. Responsive materials include, but are not limited to, any data-sharing agreements,  training materials, or other guidance materials.
• This should also include, but is not limited to, policies, records, or data related to sharing of passwords or access with local, regional, or federal task forces or agents.

USAGE DATA
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of 1/1/2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of 1/1/2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide any documents in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide PDF, CSV, or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ryan Brooks

title: CIA support for upcoming film "Hotel Tehran"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA support for upcoming film "Hotel Tehran"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) and the production of upcoming movie "Hotel Tehran" directed by Guy Moshe. Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of CIA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Hotel Tehran," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Fort Myers E Occupancy

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Fort Myers E Occupancy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request an electronic, parcel-level extract containing current Group E (Educational) occupancies and associated fire-sprinkler information for all parcels within the jurisdiction:

Please provide one CSV with the following columns (your native field names are fine):
- Parcel identifier (APN / PIN / BBL)
• Site address (street #, street, city, ZIP)
• Latitude & longitude
• Internal building / permit ID
• Year built
• Floor area (sq ft)
• Number of stories
• Current IBC occupancy code (E, A-1…A-5)
• Occupancy description
• Fire-sprinkler present (Yes / No / Unknown)
• Date of last fire-sprinkler inspection (if tracked)
• Owner name & mailing address (if stored)

If any field is not maintained, please note that rather than withholding the entire record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Cavise

title: Request for Public Records – White Stadium Public Records Requests and Responses

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Request for Public Records – White Stadium Public Records Requests and Responses
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, G.L. c. 66, § 10, I request the following records:

⸻

1. Boston Globe Request on White Stadium Cost Projections
	•	A complete copy of the public records request(s) submitted by the Boston Globe regarding White Stadium cost projections (referenced in the Globe’s coverage dated August 28, 2025).
	•	A complete copy of the City of Boston’s responses to that request, including correspondence, denial letters, or extensions issued by your office or other City departments.
	•	Any internal tracking logs, request IDs, or reference numbers assigned by the City to the Globe’s White Stadium request(s).

⸻

2. All Other White Stadium–Related Public Records Requests
	•	Copies of all other public records requests submitted to the City of Boston since January 1, 2020 concerning White Stadium, including but not limited to requests about:
	•	Cost estimates, financial projections, or budgets;
	•	Contracts, bids, procurement, or vendor solicitations;
	•	Public-private partnership agreements or memoranda of understanding;
	•	Community engagement, public comment, or meeting records;
	•	Any related correspondence.
	•	Copies of all responses issued by the City (whether granting, partially fulfilling, or denying such requests).
	•	Copies of all materials released by the City in response to the above requests.
	•	Any internal tracking logs, request IDs, or reference numbers associated with White Stadium–related requests in the City’s Public Records Center or other systems.

⸻

Standard Verification and Format Instructions
	•	If no responsive records exist for a given item, please confirm that no such records exist.
	•	Please identify the custodians and systems searched, and describe the methods used to locate responsive records.
	•	If responsive records include databases, spreadsheets, or summary logs, please provide them in a machine-readable format (e.g., .csv or Excel).
	•	Please include any available metadata showing dates of record creation, sender, and recipient, where applicable.
	•	If responsive records exist in draft or revised form, please include those versions as well.
	•	Please include any policies, notices, or instructions to staff regarding the handling, retention, deletion, or suppression of White Stadium–related requests or records.

⸻

I request that records be provided in electronic format via email. If there are any fees for fulfilling this request, please provide a detailed written estimate in advance as required by law.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Florida DOT Removal of Street Art

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida DOT Removal of Street Art
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

The Department of Transportation issued to a statement to CNN, which reported (at https://www.cnn.com/2025/08/22/us/pulse-orlando-removal-rainbow-crosswalk-hnk):

“Last week, local governments not in compliance for local roads began receiving notifications to bring their roadways up to state standards to ensure locals govern themselves accordingly,” the department told CNN in a statement. “In addition to ensuring all local governments comply, FDOT completed a review of all state-maintained roadways and is now correcting pavement markings not in compliance. That includes street art previously installed on state right of way, such as the intersection of Orange Avenue in question.”

I request a copy of all the "notifications to bring their roadways up to state standards" with respect to "pavement markings" or "street art" as referenced by the Department's statement.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: MoValley Death comms

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: MoValley Death comms
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All ICE records pertaining to the death of Chaofeng Ge at the Moshannon Valley ICE Processing Center, announced August 6, 2025. 

An adequate search will include, but not be limited to, tasking the following custodians: 

ICE ERO PHL
IHSC 
ICE ODO ERAU
ICE HQ
ICE OAQ
ICE Public Affairs

An adequate search will yield, at minimum: 
1. IHSC's preliminary mortality review. 
2. GEO's Significant Event Notification or Significant Incident Report regarding the subject's death in custody. 
3. ICE Public Affairs communications regarding the announcement of this death. 
4. Communications and attachments thereto regarding the detainee death review, mortality review, and healthcare and security compliance analysis. 

I respectfully request expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) and hereby declare and certify under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 that the following statements are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and understanding: 

1. I am a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination via edited publications. See, e.g., https://theappeal.org/authors/andrew-free/; https://atlpresscollective.com/author/free/. 
2. There is an urgent need to inform the public of the conditions that produced this subject's death. ICE has invested a substantial portion of its detention funds in the facilities and services provided by The GEO Group. Systems failures within GEO facilities stand to impact tens of thousands of noncitizens who will be incarcerated by ICE in those spaces. 
3. Deaths and other harms in ICE custody have been the subject of widespread media attention about which there is substantial evidence that government oversight of its contractors is sorely lacking.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: Zebra / Death Angels Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Zebra / Death Angels Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the ATF case file and any associated communications for the 1973-74 Zebra Killings (aka Death Angels) in San Francisco, CA. ATF provided ballistics analysis and testimony that helped support the conviction of several men, as set forth in People v. Cooks (Cal. App. 1983). The state criminal case numbers for the prosecution were CRI-00630958 (Jessie Lee Cooks), CRI-00630956 (Larry Craig Green), CRI-00630948 (Manuel Moore), CRI-00630954 (JCX Simon).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: David Peter Bergland (June 4, 1935 – June 3, 2019)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: David Peter Bergland (June 4, 1935 – June 3, 2019)
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to David Peter Bergland. He was born on June 4, 1935 and died on June 3, 2019.

ABOUT THE SUBJECT

David P. Bergland  was an attorney as well as the 1984 Libertarian Party candidate for President.

PROOF OF DEATH

Attached is Mr. Bergland’s obituary from The Orange County Register.

SCOPE OF SEARCH
Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center and the Central Records Complex (CRC) in Winchester/Frederick County, Virginia. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed or transferred to NARA, please produce all records related to the transfer or destruction. If previously-released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

FEES

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. If you nonetheless decide to charge me fees, please inform me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that this request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION

Thank you for your processing of this request.

Yours truly,
Nicholas Sarwark

title: Communications about Jordan Wick working for FCC while at CFPB

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications about Jordan Wick working for FCC while at CFPB
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to FOIAed documents released by Frequency Forward, Jordan Wick was detailed from DOGE (or possibly the OPM) to the FCC on March 18th, 2025 (see https://frequencyfwd.com/files/motion-exhibit-1-08252025.pdf). In these documents, Jordan Wick sends an undated letter to the FCC stating that he is a software engineer for Department of Government Efficiency who will be providing his services for free for up to 40 hours a week over 120 days. From a separate exhibit in a different case, I also know that Jordan Wick was onboarded as a full-time employee of the CFPB on March 5th.

It is my understanding that any outside employment would need to be approved by CFPB lawyers before it could commence. I would like to request any communications between March 5th and March 18th about Jordan WIck's work at other agencies, especially if this required approval from CFPB staff or leadership. I would also like to understand if Jordan Wick's position at the CFPB has been a paid one or if he is serving in a voluntary capacity in his role. Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Harris

title: Louisville Metropolitan Police Department Firearm Seizure Data, 2012-2024 (Louisville Metro Police)

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Louisville Metropolitan Police Department Firearm Seizure Data, 2012-2024 (Louisville Metro Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All available records of firearms seized, confiscated by or surrendered to the Louisville Metro Police Department (LMPD) from 2012 to 2024. 

1. Proof of Existing Public Records (Prior Release)
This request builds upon the previously published dataset titled:
“Louisville Metro KY – Firearm Data normalized addresses January 1st 2010 – February 22nd 2017”
https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/louisville-metro-ky-firearm-data-normalized-addresses-january-1st-2010-february-22nd-2017
That dataset, which contains firearm recovery records with structured fields (e.g., FIREARMS_MODEL, FIREARMS_CALIBER, RECOVERY_DATE, UCR_CATEGORY), serves as proof of concept that such records exist, are regularly collected by LMPD, and have previously been released to the public.

2. Records Requested
I request all available firearm seizure or intake records collected by LMPD, including but not limited to the time span before and after the dataset above.
Please include fields such as:
FIREARMS_MAKE
FIREARMS_MODEL
FIREARMS_CALIBER
RECOVERY_DATE (date seized or recovered)
UCR_CATEGORY (associated crime or offense type)
Any additional firearm-specific attributes (e.g., serial number, type, manufacturer)
I am not requesting address or location data.

3. Preferred Format
Please provide the records in machine-readable formats (e.g. CSV, Excel, or similar), including the full data schema or data dictionary.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andy Friedman

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request the National Nuclear Security Administration for list of all films and TV shows filmed at NIF, Los Alamos, Lawrence Livermore, and Sandia National Laboratories for 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list and/or reports of all films and television shows permitted to film at the National Ignition Facility (NIF,) the Los Alamos National Laboratory, the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, and the Sandia National Laboratories for the year of 2023.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to support provided by the FBI to author Catherine Coulter in connection with her 2021 novel "Vortex: An FBI Thriller." An "FBI National Press and Operations Unit" internal circular, which was released to me by the FBI through FOIA and which is attached to this request, indicates that the FBI "provided technical assistance" to this project.

title: IHSC Stewart 911 SENs/SIRs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IHSC Stewart 911 SENs/SIRs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Significant Event Notifications and Significant Incident Reports received by the IHSC Field Medical Coordinator or OAQ Contracting Officer pertaining to medical emergencies or 911 calls at the Stewart Detention Center for the period beginning January 1, 2024, and continuing through August 26, 2025. 

I request expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) and declare the following statements in support thereof to be true and correct under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746: 

1. The Stewart Detention Center has the highest number of deaths in ICE custody of any facility in the ICE detention since FY17. 
2. Stewart is currently one of the most populated sites of detention in the ICE system. 
3. Calls to 911 in 2025 from Stewart have exceeded their numbers for any period over the past five years. 
4. Audio recordings of Stewart 911 calls reflect instances in which EMS units were unavailable to treat significant illnesses or injuries as a result of previous calls from the facility.
5. Lack of access to timely emergency medical care threatens the health safety of people in Stewart and the surrounding community. 
6. ICE Mortality Reviewers have attributed lack of timely access to emergency medical care to a significant number of deaths in ICE custody. 
7. The records requested will shed light on whether, and to what extent, ICE is aware of the challenges posed and consequences created by its use of detention in high numbers at the Stewart facility. 
8. DHS-OIG, ICE OPR, IHSC, ICE ODO, Congress, and the General Accountability Office have all previously cited CoreCivic, ICE's Atlanta Field Office, and Stewart for violations of ICE's standards and contracts. 
9. I am a member of the media primarily engaged in information dissemination through edited publications, and have previously been granted expedited processing by federal FOIA offices on this basis. 
10. These records are needed on an expedited basis to fill out the federal side of a piece for which I have received journalism grant funding and which will be published no later than October.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Your Arizona State University public records request #25-375 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Arizona State University ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-375 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for submitting a public records request to Arizona State University. We will begin reviewing your request now. If we need additional information to process it, or if we are unable to do so, we will be in touch with you shortly.  Otherwise, we will begin gathering any responsive records from the relevant departments and/or individuals at ASU. After the records have been gathered and individually reviewed to determine if they are responsive and whether any confidential information needs to be withheld or redacted, they will be provided to you. The amount of time necessary to complete this process varies depending on a variety of factors, including how extensive the request is, how responsive information is stored, and what kinds of review and redaction are necessary.  Please be aware that ASU receives a large number of records requests and we may be occupied in processing requests received prior to yours. You are welcome to check on the status of your request at any time through the online portal you used to submit your request (https://asu.nextrequest.com/). When the responsive documents are ready for you, you may also use this portal to access them and to pay any charges associated with your request. If you have additional questions regarding this process or the status of your request, you may submit them through the portal or by email to publicrecords@asu.edu.  ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Arizona State University.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.communication:
Dear Mrs. North: 
Thank you for submitting your request for government records of Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the New Jersey Open Public Records Act (OPRA), NJSA 47:1 et seq. Your request was received through the online, public portal Rutgers University Open Public Records Center of this office on 8/27/2025 and given the reference number R010068-082725. 

Your request will be forwarded to the Office of the Custodian of Records for review and processing, including determining the volume of responsive documents and any potential costs associated with satisfying your request. Please note, the N.J. Open Public Records Act does not require the University to create new documents, to conduct research, or to answer questions for information. 

Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring rights, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities. Including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Kelly North
